image.title: The Standard World News
image.description: Standardmedia.co.ke We deliver breaking news from across Kenya and the globe and information on the latest top stories, business, sports and entertainment headlines. Follow the news as it happens through: special reports, videos, audio, photo gallerie and many more.

item.title: Biden welcomes Sweden's acceptance into NATO as Summit begins
item.description: President Joe Biden welcomed news late Monday that Sweden will be admitted to NATO, overcoming objections from the last holdout in the security alliance, Turkey.
item.dc:creator: Standard Digital

item.title: Twitter chaos leaves door open for Meta's rival app
item.description: Since buying Twitter last year for $44 billion, Musk has fired thousands of employees and charged users $8 a month to have a blue checkmark and a "verified" account.
item.dc:creator: Standard Digital

item.title: From sports to entertainment, Saudi redefines its global role
item.description: 3 of the 4 active Ballon dOr winners will be plying their trade in Saudi Arabia. A US-based PGA Tour and LIV Gold deal will see the finest golfers playing there, some for the first time ever.
item.dc:creator: Standard Digital

item.title: Turkey detains dozens of LGBTQ activists during pride march
item.description: Turkish police have ramped up a crackdown on LGBTQ activists as dozens of people were detained Sunday at Pride marches in Turkey's metropolitan Istanbul and Izmir provinces.
item.dc:creator: Standard Digital

item.title: Russian Missile Attacks Kill 3 and Injure 8 in Kyiv
item.description: This is Russias eighth attack on the Ukrainian capital in June, said Serhii Popko, the head of the Kyiv City Military Administration.
item.dc:creator: Standard Digital

item.title: UN's World Refugee Day celebrates courage and contributions of refugees
item.description: This year's World Refugee Day shines a light on the plight of 35.4 million refugees and asylum seekers, on their needs and legal rights for international protection.
item.dc:creator: Standard Digital

item.title: Controversial influencer Andrew Tate charged with rape, human trafficking
item.description: British-American social media influencer Andrew Tate charged with rape, human trafficking, forming a criminal group to sexually exploit women, prosecutors say.
item.dc:creator: Standard Digital

item.title: US issues travel advisory against Uganda after anti-gay bill signed into law
item.description: The United States government has cautioned its citizens against travelling to Uganda, following the recent enactment of the anti-gay bill into law, and other reasons including crime and terrorism.
item.dc:creator: Standard Digital

item.title: ILO: Child labor on rise following decades of progress
item.description: The ILO reports that conflicts, natural and man-made crises, and the Covid-19 pandemic have plunged more families into poverty and forced millions more children into child labor
item.dc:creator: Standard Digital

item.title: Former Italian Prime Minister Silvio Berlusconi is dead
item.description: According to Italian Media, Berlusconi 86, diead at San Raffaele Hospital in Milan where he was undergoing treatment.
item.dc:creator: Standard Digital

item.title: Australia to ban public display of Nazi symbols
item.description: New legislation is set to be introduced next week in the Australian parliament that will ban the public display of Nazi symbols with offenders facing up to a year in prison.
item.dc:creator: Standard Digital

item.title: US sanctions 17 Chinese, Mexican targets over fentanyl production
item.description: The move by the U.S. Treasury Department, coordinated with the Mexican government, is part of a U.S. crackdown on the flow of fentanyl and other illicit drugs from Mexico.
item.dc:creator: Standard Digital

item.title: U.S. considering sanctions against Uganda after enacting anti-gay bill into law
item.description: U.S President Joe Biden has called for the cancellation of the new anti-homosexuality law passed by Ugandan his counterpart Yoweri Museveni.
item.dc:creator: Standard Digital

item.title: U.S. Embassy closed today in honour of fallen soldiers
item.description: U.S close embassy in honor of the men and women who gave their lives while serving their country
item.dc:creator: Standard Digital

item.title: Court sentences four Hong Kong students in bomb plot
item.description: The four previously pleaded guilty to conspiracy to cause an explosion after police thwarted their plot and arrested them in July 2021.
item.dc:creator: Standard Digital

item.title: Rapprochement is fragile as US, China put irritants aside
item.description: U.S. Commerce Secretary Gina Raimondo met with her Chinese counterpart, Wang Wentao raised export policies, trade and investment issues that have been straining bilateral ties.
item.dc:creator: Standard Digital

item.title: Geneva airport briefly closed as climate activists protest private jet fair
item.description: Geneva's airport was briefly closed as climate activists stormed a private jet fair by ripping down or scaling fences, handcuffing themselves to landing gear
item.dc:creator: Standard Digital

item.title: UN chief: Warring nations must protect civilians
item.description: The U.N. Secretary-General said Tuesday that the world is failing to live up to its commitments to protect civilians, an obligation that is preserved in international humanitarian law.
item.dc:creator: Standard Digital

item.title: Brazil declares health emergency amid Avian Flu cases in wild birds
item.description: Brazil declared a state of animal health emergency for 180 days in response to the country's first detection of the highly pathogenic avian influenza virus in wild birds
item.dc:creator: Standard Digital

item.title: G7 agrees on Ukraine jets, China 'economic coercion' statement
item.description: Biden informed G-7 leaders that the United States will support a joint effort with allies and partners to train Ukrainian pilots on fourth-generation fighter aircraft, including F-16s
item.dc:creator: Standard Digital

item.title: Thousands protest violence in Serbia as authorities reject opposition criticism, demands
item.description: Tens of thousands of people rallied in Serbia's capital Friday for the third time in a month to protest the government's handling of a crisis after two mass shootings in the Balkan country.
item.dc:creator: Standard Digital

item.title: In Hiroshima, G7 leaders grapple with nuclear threat
item.description: The leaders met a bomb survivor and laid wreaths at a cenotaph honoring the victims, in sight of the Genbaku Dome, the only structure left standing following the 1945 attack by U.S
item.dc:creator: Standard Digital

item.title: US lawmakers issue dire warnings on China competition
item.description: More than half a dozen witnesses told lawmakers about the ways China uses its economic might to coerce smaller countries into providing favorable trade arrangements
item.dc:creator: Standard Digital

item.title: G7 to increase financial pressure on Russia
item.description: Members of the Group of Seven wealthy democracies will act at this year's G-7 summit to pile more sanctions on Russia and crack down on those helping it evade them.
item.dc:creator: Standard Digital

item.title: Surge of record global temperatures expected in next five years
item.description: WMO warns global temperatures are likely to surge to record levels in the next five years, with temperatures reaching more than 1.5 degrees Celsius above pre-industrial levels for at least one year.
item.dc:creator: Standard Digital

item.title: Prince Harry, wife Meghan in 'near catastrophic car chase' with paparazzi
item.description: Britain's Prince Harry, his wife Meghan and her mother were involved in a "near catastrophic car chase" involving paparazzi photographers, a spokesperson for the prince said on Wednesday.
item.dc:creator: Standard Digital

item.title: What President William Ruto said in Johannesburg that earned him a standing ovation
item.description: President William Ruto addressed the Pan-African Parliament Summit on Climate Policy and Equity in Johannesburg at the invitation of the President of the Pan-African Parliament Fortune Charumbira.
item.dc:creator: Standard Digital

item.title: China's rising clout spotlighted at finance chief meetings before G7 Summit
item.description: G7 host Japan persuaded its G7 counterparts to launch a new program by the end of 2023 to diversify supply chains for strategically important goods away from China.
item.dc:creator: Standard Digital

item.title: Elon Musk names Linda Yaccarino new Twitter CEO
item.description: Elon Musk confirmed that the new CEO of Twitter will be NBCUniversals Linda Yaccarino, an executive with deep ties to the advertising industry.
item.dc:creator: Standard Digital

item.title: Former Pakistan PM Imran Khan freed on bail
item.description: The court said Khan could not be arrested for the time being in other pending corruption cases against him.
item.dc:creator: Standard Digital
